title: New Credentials Added Feature
custom_preconds:
User is logged in to MLB QA Ticketing Admin. https://qa-ticketing-admin.mlb.com/contextmappingatlas
The "New Credentials" button is visible on the page.
custom_steps:
Click on the "New Credentials" button.
Verify that a new page opens with a form for entering credentials.
Enter all required information in the form fields, such as credential type, name, description, and expiration date etc.
Click on the "NEW CREDENTIAL" button to save the credentials.
Check the credentials list to ensure that the newly added credentials are displayed.
custom_expected: The new credentials should be successfully saved and displayed in the credentials list.

title: CMA - Edit Icon
custom_preconds:
User is logged in to MLB QA Ticketing Admin Console.
There is at least one existing credential in the list.
custom_steps:
Locate the desired credential in the list.
Click on the edit icon next to the credential.
Make the necessary changes, such as updating the password or expiration date etc.
Click on the "EDIT CREDENTIAL" button to save the updated credential.
Verify that the updated credential is reflected in the list.
custom_expected: The changes made to the credential should be successfully saved and reflected in the credentials list.

title: Verify successful deletion of a credential using the API
custom_preconds:
1. Obtain the credentialID of the credential to be deleted.
2. Create a new credential through the CMA credentials UI.
3. Check if the new credentials have been successfully added to the UI.
4. Set the Authorization header in the API request to ApiKey with the Ticketing Admin2 key.
5. Make a DELETE request to the endpoint: [https://qa-atlas.mlbinfra.net/api/v1/credentials/$credentialID](https://qa-atlas.mlbinfra.net/api/v1/credentials/$credentialID)
6. Verify if the status code of the response is 204.
7. Verify the deletion of the credential through the UI.

title: Verify deletion of a non-existing credential using the API
custom_preconds:
1. Generate a non-existing credentialID.
2. Create a new credential through the CMA credentials UI.
3. Check if the new credentials have been successfully added to the UI.
4. Set the Authorization header in the API request to ApiKey with the Ticketing Admin2 key.
5. Make a DELETE request to the endpoint: [https://qa-atlas.mlbinfra.net/api/v1/credentials/$nonExistingCredentialID](https://qa-atlas.mlbinfra.net/api/v1/credentials/$nonExistingCredentialID)
6. Verify if the status code of the response is 404.

title: Verify credential still exists in UI after failed deletion using the API
custom_preconds:
1. Obtain the credentialID of the credential to be deleted.
2. Create a new credential through the CMA credentials UI.
3. Check if the new credentials have been successfully added to the UI.
4. Set the Authorization header in the API request to ApiKey with the Ticketing Admin2 key.
5. Make a DELETE request to the endpoint: [https://qa-atlas.mlbinfra.net/api/v1/credentials/$credentialID](https://qa-atlas.mlbinfra.net/api/v1/credentials/$credentialID)
6. Verify if the status code of the response is 404.
7. Verify the credential still exists in the UI.

title: Verify the Remove Override Button allows the user to remove the override
custom_preconds:
User Override Removal
As a user
I want to delete an existing override
So that I can remove it permanently
GIVEN
User with Admin access https://qa-ticketing-admin.mlb.com/ops/boxoffice AND Access BoxOffice
custom_steps:
WHEN
User scrolls down to the override section
AND
The User wants to delete an existing override
AND 
The User clicks on the "Remove Override" button at the bottom of the page
custom_expected:
THEN
A pop-up message should appear with the warning text "Are you sure? Removing this override will delete it permanently and its configurations will be lost."
AND
The user clicks on the yes button and the override is removed. The page refreshes and the user can see that the override has been removed and its configurations are no longer visible.
